Name: Equation Golf
Description: Play golf while you learn to compute combinations of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, cubes, square roots, and more. Using 60 cards in the deck along with golf terminology, players draw "stroke" cards to create equations which solve a target number. After nine rounds of play the game is over and the player with the lowest score wins the game.

Name: Renegade Legion: Leviathan – The Wake of the Kraken
Description:
Renegade Legion: Leviathan Scenario Book - 64 pages with 15 new scenarios.

This book includes a background story of the INS Kraken and it's new commander, Rear Admiral Luther Catalus.  Catalus has run afoul of Imperial politics and has been sent on a suicide mission.  The book covers the campaign fought by the INS Kraken and it's escort squadron in 15 interlinked scenarios.  The campaign is designed to be played through with the same units and track damage between scenarios.  Rules are included to cover resupply and repair.  Complete profiles of the key members of the Kraken Squadron are also included.

The book also provides the designs of several ships, many of which are also included the Renegade Legion: Leviathan Capital Ship Briefing.  Other ships are new to this book.  These ships are:
   Leicester Class Freighter
   Republic Class Battleship
   Gav'Rosk Class Cruiser
   Raptor Class Destroyer Carrier
   VLCA design
   GavRon Listening Post

Special scenario rules also include a battle within an asteroid field that has hidden units and objectives.

Expands:

    Renegade Legion: Leviathan

Name: Renegade Legion: 2nd ACR Armored Cavalry Regiment
Description:
Renegade Legion: Centurion Scenario Book - 48 pages with 12 new scenarios, as well as new units, characters and equipment.

Expands:

    Renegade Legion: Centurion â€“ Blood & Steel

Name: Clock Dominoes
Description: 45 durable dominoes are included in this challenging game. It may be played at three levels of difficulty, covering hours, half hours, and quarter hours using clock faces, digital time, and written time. 1-4 players. Grades 2-6

Name: Renegade Legion: Centurion – Blood & Steel: Vehicle Briefing
Description:
Renegade Legion: Centurion Vehicle Briefing Book - 128 pages describing 58 different vehicles and variants.

Expands:

    Renegade Legion: Centurion â€“ Blood & Steel

Name: Bahcheck
Description: The object of the game is to advance all of your stakes to the finish line before your opponent in order to win. The game can be played opposite each other or side-by-side. When playing opposite each other, the game cards must be placed in the card bay so that the green block is at the bottom and at the player’s right. Playing side-by-side, both cards must be placed with the green block at the bottom. Stakes must be advanced vertically only. There are three (3) versions to this game: RANDOM, MIX, and FIX. Random is the basic version and should be learned first....

Name: Chase Whole Numbers
Description: Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in either the ones, tens, hundreds and thousands place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board. Grades 1-4

Name: Chase Large Numbers
Description: Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in the thousand, millions, up to the hundred millions place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board.

Name: Chase Decimals
Description: Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in either the tenths, hundredths, and thousandths place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board. Grades 4-7

Name: Einparken bis zum Abwinken
Description:
This uses a similar idea to the popular 'parking' puzzles but in a strategy game. Each player has 5 vehicles - 3 normal cars (2x1 spaces), a bus (3x1 spaces) and a Smart car (1x1). On your turn you have 3 choices: 1) Place a vehicle face down, 2) Turn one of your vehicles face up and choose its direction of travel without altering its position (so the larger vehicles can choose two directions, the Smart can choose four), 3) Move one of your vehicles one space in its direction of travel. 
The aim is to be the last player to be able to move. Even if one cannot move at some stage of the game if your way is subsequently cleared you can still move then.

Name: Play Gauss
Description: This is a collection of 12 games playable with the same components released to commemorate the 150th anniversary of Gauss' death. The games are mainly 2 player. They use a set of wooden blocks which come in lengths of 1 to 6. A die is used in many of them to determine the length of the piece to be placed. There are variants on connecting-sides-of-the-board, placement-within-a-limited-space, moving- across-the-board, blocking and capturing games. 8 are adult games, 4 children's games. There are also an additional 2 adult games by Peter Lewe.

Name: Discount
Description: Over 400 real-life challenges are included in this great game. Players learn to purchase furniture, clothing, appliances and more. Extensive drill in computing percentages, fractional discounts, keeping financial records and reconciling accounts is covered. Great for home use, and learning centers. 2-4 Players Grades 5-12

Name: Die Wackelpudding-Jagd
Description:
In the center of the board, there are wobble puddings in a clearing. Players roll a die and move their 'little monster' to collect them and bring them back to their home. But the puddings are guarded by a dragon, which may be moved when the players roll its symbol. Players can be send home like in pachisi, with the capturing player also capturing the pudding.

The game ends when all 10 puddings are distributed. They have 1-3 points on the bottom side, and the player with the highest total wins.

Name: Gamegame
Description:
A description from Greg Costikyan:

Aki Jarvinen has posted cards and rules for GameGame 1.0… which he pitches as an attempt to do for games what Understanding Comics does for comics: that is, to provide insight into the nature of games in a game, in the same what that Understanding is both “about comics” and a comic.

Thus, his cards are things like “Goal” and “Environment” and “Victory/End Condition.” There’s both a coherent set of rules for determining victory and a roleplaying element: players must improvise what the game they are creating is like, e.g., describing what their “Victory/End Condition” is–but they can only have one if they have the relevant card.

Version 2.0 recently became available at the website below.

Website:  http://gamegame.blogs.com/

Name: Henne Berta
Description: In Henne Berta (Hen Berta in English) the player feeds a hen with grain and in return gathers eggs to a little basket. The first player that gets 3 eggs to basket is the winner. The game contains a wooden board, large wooden pieces and little baskets for every player.

Name: RPM
Description: RPM is a race simulation released by Grow during the 80's in Brazil.

Name: Math Around The School
Description: How long did John Glenn orbit the earth? This and many more curious questions are included in this fun-filled game. History, math, problem solving, and trivia are incorporated into three levels of difficulty so that students at different ability levels can be challenged as they play together. 2-4 Players Grade 3-8

Name: Place Search Small Numbers
Description: Place Search is a great activity in a four-sided domino format. Players match words with their corresponding numerals. Two levels of difficulty cover numbers through the thousands place. 1-4 players. Grades 3-12

Name: Place Search Large Numbers
Description: Place Search is a great activity in a four-sided domino format. Players match words with their corresponding numerals. Two levels of difficulty cover numbers through the hundred millions place. 1-4 players. Grades 3-12

Name: Tic Tac Frac
Description: Using the tic-tac-toe format and three levels of difficulty, students are immersed in competitive drill with equivalent fractions.

Name: Equivalent Fraction Dominoes
Description: This game contains 45 dominoes and five game ideas using halves, thirds, fourths, fifths, sixths, and eighths. It's great for home use or learning centers.

Name: Operação MX-1
Description:
Most likely the first "real" wargame (by today's standards) released in Brazil, it had lukewarm reception during the 80's and has been discontinued. 
The game simulates a battle between two fictitious armies, using an hexagonal board and two sets of rules: basic and advanced.
This is the same Avalon Hill's Tactics II (1958), with a redesigned hexgrid mapboard.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Foxhole 2: Poland
Description:
"Jon Compton's tactical hex and counter game of WWII combat. This set focuses on Germany versus Poland at the start of the war."

Each hex on the map represents an area approximately 100 yards across. Each playing piece represents about 40-60 men (a platoon) or half a dozen vehicles or towed weapons . . . For ease of play, the game scales are approximated. Time is also abstracted, thus turns represent several minutes.

The FOXHOLE system is simple to learn and fast playing that focuses on the invasion of Poland. Its a good diversion from the more heavy fair of historical board-wargaming.

FOXHOLE SET 2 includes:
-Ten new scenarios, six exclusively with this set, and four incorporating elements from Set 1.
-Twenty-four unit cards
-Over one hundred playing pieces -Tactical Battles Map A - and One rule book

Name: Number One
Description: This game is played on a hex board, you have 3 Figures, the first (King) can move only 1 step (if you lose that piece you are out of the game), the second piece can move 2 step and the third can move 3 step. When you move on a hex a stone fall, so the hex is no more usable. When you must move one figure on an empty hex, the first time you can turn over the figure, the second time the figure goes out of the game. If is the King all your figures go out. The last player on the board is the winner.

Name: Batter Up! Math
Description: Incorporate baseball with addition, subtraction, multiplication and division problems. With three levels of difficulty, students from first to sixth grade can have fun in pairs or small groups as the play baseball. Get the whole class involved by creating an overhead transparency from the black line master that is included. This game may also be adapted for weekly homework assignments and remedial math programs. 2-4 players or 2 teams.

Name: Napoleon's Italian Campaigns
Description:
It's the first game of a trilogy of two-player Napoleonic campaign games.
Napoleon's Italian campaigns take place during the time of Napoleon's campaigns from 1796 through 1800 in Italy.
The game contains the maps, 252 counters, charts and tables

Name: Romans
Description: Players journey around the Roman Empire, conquering garrison forts in a race to proclaimed "Caesar"! The fascinating history of the Roman Empire will be explored whilst playing the game!

Name: Picdoku
Description: Picdoku is a brand new pictorial version of the Sudoku craze that has gripped us all! It can be played individually or competitively by 2 players or teams. Each game includes 182 sturdy re-usable tokens and 30 double-sided playing boards so that 60 different games can be played again and again.

Name: Fraction Dominoes
Description: Using 45 dominoes, players may play at 1of 3 levels of difficulty while adding fractions to find the sum of 1. Fractional parts are shown in pictorial and numerical form. It's a great activity for home and in learning centers.

Name: Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio
Description:
Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio is a simulation of the campaign of Santiago de Cuba during the Spanish - American War.

One A3 sized map, 200 cut and paste counters.

Name: Play Ball Multiplication
Description: Introduce children to the great American pastime...BASEBALL while they practice multiplication problems with factors of 3,4,6,7,8, and 9. Multiplication problems determine base hits, singles, triples, home runs, and more. Example: 3X7 = 21 which denotes a single. 4X9 = 36 or a "triple". 2 players or teams may play. Grades 4-8

Name: Trasimeno 217 a.c.
Description: Battle of Lake Trasimene (217 BC) during the Second Punic war.

Name: 1860: I Mille
Description: "1860: I Mille" is a wargame, published on the Italian wargaming magazine "Alea Jacta Est", on the "Expedition of the Thousand", the Garibaldi's campaign against the Kingdom of Two Sicilies.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Adua 1896
Description:
The Battle of Adua, 1896: Italy against the Abyssinians. 
"Alea Iacta Est" Italian wargaming magazine, issue 4.

Name: Equivalent Fractions Match Wits
Description: Two sets of 30 quadromino tiles provide drill in equivalent fraction recognition at two levels of difficulty. Level 1 includes fractions from 1/4 to 10/12; Level 2 covers 1/4 to 21/24. Each tile shows fractions in numerical form. It's a great activity for individuals, play at home, or in learning centers.

Name: So You Think You Know Maine
Description:
From the box:
"A game of Maine trivia suitable for natives and people from away."

Players start in Kittery (Southern Maine). Counties in Maine represent different categories. As players roll and move around the board, they must collect cards at each county seat. Players then race to Fort Kent (Northern Maine) to win the game.

Name: Overlord
Description:
Overlord is a "2 player game of pure 3D strategy".

The game is played on a 7x9 board with a crenellated wall located on the middle row between the two players. Both players have 14 pieces located in the back 2 rows on each side of the wall and attempt to capture the opponents pieces by landing on top of them. Pieces move and stack in various ways, and the game is won when one player is reduced to a single stack.

Name: Synonym Line Up
Description: Three levels of difficulty are included in this fast-paced tic-tac-toe styled game. Three game cards are included and players match antonyms from their playing card, to base words found on the spinner. The first person to form a line of antonyms on the board wins the game.

Name: V-Attack
Description: The year is 2340.  Just as in all of history, conquest is at the heart of mankind.  Enslave or become a slave is the future.  You are in charge of breaking through the wall of your enemy’s city to allow the entry of your battalion to take over.  Organic Titazium metal (O37T2y) has been used in the construction of all walls during this time period, which makes them virtually impenetrable.  The wall cubes must be removed carefully or the wall structure will collapse and repair itself thus defeating your mission.  While you are attacking the walls of your enemy, they in turn are attacking you.  By using limited means, you must minimize the damage directed to your city.  Victory belongs to he who enters the city first.

Name: The Complete Book of Games
Description:
This is a very large book (900 pages) explaining rules to all kinds of games.  The first 300 pages are dedicated solely to card games.  The book then moves on to traditional board and dice games such as checkers, backgammon, and craps.  There are many word and guessing games.  Outdoor activities are also listed, including races, snow or water games, lawn games, and full-blown sports.

Ideas for adults' get-togethers include quick-thinking contests and even dancing games.  The book details countless games for children, suitable for everyday play or social events such as birthday parties.  Some of the party games are geared toward specific holidays.

This huge volume devotes one little paragraph to branded games such as Monopoly, Pit, and Flinch.  It only mentions that they exist, and require special equipment, which is purchased along with the rules.

Although you'll find very familiar entries such as bridge, marbles, and baseball, many of the games are less known, or a variation on a more familiar idea.  Some of the names are intriguing in their own right.  Here's a sampling of names of the many games to learn:

Misery Nap
Bierspiel
Anti-nudist
Hearts of Lettuce
Skeegee-Weegee
The G Man Never Takes His Ease
Literary Salad
Strawberries Without Cream
Schnozzle Race

Name: Hey, Bartender!
Description:
In Hey, Bartender! everyone is trying to take change from a friendly bartender.  Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards.  The 'bartender' also gets seven cards, played face up on the table.  The object of the game is to trade cards with the bartender, making change such that the bartender gives the player more points than the player gives the bartender.  Play continues until all players have exhausted their hands, at which time the player with the most points wins.

Hey, Bartender! was designed as another version of Pennywise played with cards, and was published in Game Trade Monthly in 1999.

Name: Escape
Description: Players learn how to build words using suffixes and base words. The base words are located within the gameboard squares, and the suffixes are listed on the spinner. Students spin and move to the first space where that suffix can be used with a base word to form a word. 245 words can be formed.

Name: Wolf im Schafspelz
Description: Wolf im Schafspelz (Wolf in Sheep's Clothing) is a deduction game, wherein players take turns trying to pick the wolf out from a flock of sheep using sheepdogs.  For those desiring a more complex game, trees are included to break up the sheepdogs' lines of sight.

Name: Alternative Games for Those Who Like  a Challenge
Description:
From the back cover:

"The alternative games in this booklet are all designed to be played with standard equipment. They offer exciting new dimensions to games played on or with draught boards, cards, dominoes etc., helping to eliminate the constant financial burden of purchasing expensive and often short-lived new games.

The games in Alternative Games for Those Who Like a Challenge are based on popular games that have been modified so they are even more competitive and exciting.
At the same time, they are easy to learn if you already know the standard edition, providing hours of inexpensive entertainment, making this booklet desirable for most game lovers.

Other books designed by Tony Crow are:
Alternative Games for the Family and
Alternative Games for the Studious"

This book contains rules for modified card games, draught board games, Scrabble games and billiard table games.

Name: Black Abyss
Description: Black Abyss is a space civilization game where players explore the galaxy for habitable planets and then scan the planets surface for beneficial terrain.  Players will expand their empire by colonizing these planets and erecting buildings that best use the terrain and available space of each planet.  A player will win by means of expansionary, militaristic, diplomatic, or scientific policies.  The game features great details of empire building and fleet management.

Name: Facts In Acts
Description: "Who was blinded on the road to Damascus?" "Who asked to be tried in Rome?" Players answer these and other questions from the book of Acts as they match these four-sided dominoes. There are two complete sets of dominoes with one set emphasizing people, and the other set emphasizing places. Scriptural references and an answer key is included. 2-4 players. Ages 10 and up

Name: Grammar Mania
Description: This game reinforces the proper use of grammar as players identify and correct common grammatical errors. Over 700 sentences at three levels of difficulty are included. Throughout the game there are mistakes that are commonly made in the usage of adjectives, adverbs, questions, verbs, subject verb agreement, nouns, comparisons, superlatives, gerunds, infinitives, prepositions and more. A comprehensive answer key is included. Great for all English Language Learners (ESL) low intermediate to advanced and English grades 6-12.

Name: Bible Search
Description: Bible Search is a game of advance and block whose moves are generated by correctly answering the questions, of which there are 3 categories (Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced) in each of 2 sources, the Old Testament and the New Testament.  Correctly answering a question generates 2 choices, a move to advance your pawn 1 space, or a block option which, if successful, allows you to block your opponent(s) progress, or chance missing a turn, advancing 2 spaces or moving back 2 if question incorrectly answered or advancing 1 space or moving back 2 if question incorrectly answered.

Name: Pisaturm
Description:
With 42 wooden rods ( six color groups of seven rods each) you should try to build as high a tower as possible. The color die decides if you have to put new rods on top of the tower or if you can pass the die to the next player without adding rods.

The game starts with 2 different colored rods placed parallel on the playing surface.

The first player rolls the die, if rolls the same color  as one of the rods on top of the tower, he can pass the die to the next player.

If he rolls a different color as one of the  two rods on top of the tower, he must place to new, differently colored, rods on top of the tower. These have to be placed at a right angle to the others.

You continue to play like this clockwise in turn.

The game is over when the tower collapses. The player who caused the crash loses the game.

Name: Rummy for Kids: Toy Story
Description:
This is a good introductory rummy game for children.  The game is for ages 3+ and is for 2-4 players.  There is a game board that has four toy story characters with numbers 1-6.  The idea of the game is to be the player with the most set tokens once the game board is filled.

The game board is filled by either laying a set 3 tiles of same suit in sequence (1, 2, 3 of Woody) or 3 tiles of the same number (4 woody, 4 buzz, 4 what's the horses name again).  You can also add to a set.

There is a wild card in Zurg and there are bonus plays with him.

The Sesame Street version is effectively the same game with a different character-set.

Name: Messines: 1917
Description: Scale is 240 yards per hex and each unit is a battalion or regiment.  There are also some German companies for the front trenches.  There are two 13x19" maps with over 200 counters. There are two rules books - standard rules that are 5 pages and Messines:1917 rules that run another 4 pages.  There are two scenarios - first day and campaign. Artillery is the centerpiece of the game with four different types of bombardment (saturation,  standard, intermittent, and gas) possible.  There are three types of guns - field, medium, and heavy with each best suited to certain roles.  For Messines the addition of mines makes initial set up and play a real chess match.  The key to victory is correct deployment and effective use of reserves.  For the Allies, one of the key decisions is how much to bombard.  It is very effective but it also destroys the drainage systems of the area and leads to a quagmire that with eliminated possibilities.  For the German player, commitment of reserves is the key.  He has to guess correctly at the main points of attack by the British player before they have sufficiently evolved to make the attack plan apparent.

Name: JoBa
Description: This trick-taking game is played with a standard deck of playing cards.  Each game, a pair of dice is rolled.  The first die determines how many cards are held in each player's hand (1-6); the other die is special and determines the trump suit.  The second die may come up "no trump" (there is no trump suit) or "no suit" (suit doesn't matter, only face value).  Chips are used to keep score.  Players must ante up before each hand, and the pot is won by the first player to reach eleven points (or to have the highest score after four hands).  Scoring centers around the fact that at start of each game, players use bidding wheels to predict how many hands they can win.  Penalties are applied for guessing incorrectly, while guessing correctly and winning all tricks in a hand can lead to an instant win.

Name: The Good Steward Game
Description: Good stewardship of time, ability, and money is an important part of life. This exciting game introduces children to the principles of good stewardship. As players move around the game board they earn money for a variety of tasks. They learn to put money in savings and in the church offering. There are opportunities to spend money, recycle and do community service projects. A scripture memory component is also included. For 2-4 players. Ages 6 - 12

Name: Your Number's Up!
Description: Your Number's Up is a fast-paced game for 2 to 6 players. The object of the game is to score as many points as possible, by completing simple sums. The first player lays a number card down and subsequent players have to complete the sum. The player completing the sum takes the three cards as their trick and starts the next round. Sounds easy? Well maybe! What happens if you cannot complete the sum? You have to pick up a spare card and wait for your next turn. This game can be played by people with all levels of ability and in our testing, we found some people with devious minds who tried to stop others winning tricks. I'm sure you wouldn't do this! It's fun, but make sure number isn't up by having a handful of cards at the end.

Name: Trilemma
Description: A multi-level maths game to support the national numeracy strategy in an entertaining way. Trilemma tests the times tables and other mathematical functions non-sequentially. This challenging game of chance and skill can be played in a mixed age group with different players choosing different levels within the same game.

Name: Abbott's New Card Games
Description:
This book contains nine new card games mostly played with a regular deck. Some of these games were also published separately.


    Babel - A real time party game that simulates the stock market. This can play a large number of people as long as you have enough card decks to pull it off (1/3 the number of players)



    Leopard - A card game that allows you to sabotage your opponent.



    Auction - An auction game where the playing cards are money.



    Variety - A game that uses bidding to counteract the possibility of getting a bad hand.



    Metamorphosis - A trick taking game where the rules change each hand.



    Switch - A partnership game where the partners switch every hand.



    Eleusis - An induction game.



    Construction - A board game where the board is built with cards.



    Ultima - A fast action chess variant.

Name: One Card Game
Description: Here's a great card game for visual learners! Players match equivalent fractions or find sums of "ONE." Included are cards representing halves, thirds, fourths, sixths, and eighths. Each card pictures a fraction, gives the number word, and shows its corresponding numeral.

Name: Addition and Multiplication Dominoes
Description: Eleven games are included in this domino game. It's a great activity for individual drill on addition and multiplication, or it can be used in a small group in a learning center.

Name: Percentage Dominoes
Description: Here's a great way to learn about percentages using dominoes! It's a great game for individuals, or small groups in a learning center.

Name: Subtraction Dominoes
Description: Subtraction Dominoes provide a unique way to learn subtraction facts with differences from 1 to 18. It's a great learning tool for individual or small group us in a learning center environment.

Name: Battle of the Monsters
Description: Battle of the Monsters is a set of several games that can be played using the trading cards included in the Weird n' Wild Creatures collectors set. Weird n' Wild Creatures is a set of colorful data cards covering monsters of nature and mythology. The creatures on the data cards are also depicted on trading cards which list values for attack, defense, and life, which are used to play the Battle of the Monsters games. Some cards also list special powers. The games that can be played with the cards range from the very simple (a war variant where cards and drawn and attack values are compared) to the strategic.

Name: John Campbell's Classic Harness Racing
Description:
From the tube...
".. a game which truly simulates real harness racing.  You control your horse's speed, decide when to make your move and make all of the other decisions.  Your driving skill - not just luck - determines the outcome."     The object is to drive your horse the farthest twice around the track.

Yes the game is packaged in a tube. The "board" is a piece of fabric backed printed vinyl, similar to a place mat.  Players are assigned or pick a horse from a choice of 200 in the Stable book.  Each horse has a movement number that is broken down into quarters (4 numbers), one for each quarter mile (track is a half mile).  These quarter mile numbers are then reduced to 6 numbers, from 1 to 9.  These 6 numbers are printed on cards.  On his turn the player uses one card to move his horse.  The move is modified by: spaces that count as two, variable length lanes in the curves, swaping cards with the draw pile without changing the movement #, holding back a card till the next quarter mile, blocking another from holding back a card, chance cards at the start and on the home stretch, chance dice roll is required to pass thru a space directly in front of another horse.  It is recommended to have a race secretary.  This person should be a fair minded person who will set up and referee the race.

The players try to use all of their movement while causing others to waste movement.  This player has observed that it is easy for all of the players to use all of their movement with only 6 horses in the race.  All of the movement robbing mechanisms are easily avoided with 6 horses.  The race is then determined by the movement number combined with the Start and Stretch chance cards.  The use of 12 horses makes a much more interesting game.  With 12 horses the movement robbing mechanisms can not be totally avoided.

John Campbell is a Hall of Fame driver (not rider) that holds many of the sport's records.  John Campbell did not design the game but has endorsed it.  The 1989 instructions invite players to a yearly tournament where the championship is decided by playing against John Campbell.

The instructions promote another game, "Classic Thoroughbred Racing" which is not currently in the BGG database.

Name: Sergeants! Scenarios Book 1
Description:
From the publisher:

Sergeants!™ Scenarios Book 1 contains 23 new scenarios that appear nowhere else. In addition, inside are Map boards 2, 3 and 4 (which have been provided on our website), and are now included professionally printed along with brand-new Map board 6. Requires at least one Sergeants: On the Eastern Front game set.

Included:

4 Map boards

Scenario Booklet

Name: Tic-Tac-Sum
Description: Here's a basic addition activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover addition problems from 1 to 20. Great for home use or in learning centers.

Name: Tic-Tac-Subtract
Description: Here's a basic subtraction activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover subtraction problems from 1 to 20. Great for home use or in learning centers.

Name: Tic-Tac-Times
Description: Here's a basic multiplication activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover basic multiplication problems. Great for home use or in learning centers.

Name: Tic-Tac-Divide
Description: Here's a basic division activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover basic division problems. Great for home use or in learning centers.

Name: Arithmattack
Description: This exciting game sharpens player's addition and subtraction skills as they capture spaces on the board by adding together numerals printed on color-coded disks. Strategy is used to capture other players spaces by exchanging disks on their own space or on an opponent's space. The winner is the player who is the first to capture four squares in one row, one column or one diagonal. Great for two players or teams. Grades 2-8

Name: Genial daneben: Das Spiel – Zusatzfragen
Description:
Extra question cards for the game with the same name.

Expands:

    Genial daneben: Das Spiel

Name: Thalassa
Description:
A nautical quiz game where navigators must sail the seas and answer questions about ecology and the rules of the sea.

Themed on the show of the same name on France 3.

Name: Strudel
Description: Strudel (Eddies) is essentially Parchisi in reverse; players try not to be the first to lose all four pieces to the eddies.  Every turn, players roll two dice, advance any pieces from their start area if possible, and then use any remaining dice to move their own pieces or even whole rings of currents.

Name: Vampirino
Description: The sneaky bats have escaped!  Fly to their rescue with Mother Bat and bring them back to the cave!  With luck and skill, be the first to catch four bats!

Name: Triad
Description: Competition and strategy makes this game fun and exciting. Players learn to build words by connecting prefix, suffix, and base words. It's great for two players or two teams. Grades 4-8

Name: EinStein würfelt nicht! Erweiterung
Description:
3-4 Players expansion to "EinStein wÃ¼rfelt nicht!"

Rules are as in the 2 players version of "EinStein wÃ¼rfelt nicht!", with some modifications:

The game board is 6×6 square fields large.

Each player controls 6 playing pieces i.e. stones with the numbers 1 to 6 marked on them.

The stones of each players are set up in the six fields of one corner of the board.

During his turn a player rolls a die; if he still has the stone with the number corresponding to the rolled value on the board he must move this stone. If the corresponding stone was already removed from play (see below) the player may choose to either move the stone with the next higher or the next lower number available.

In his move a player may move the stone one field horicontally, vertically or diagonally towards the diagonally opposite corner. It is not allowed to move backwards.

If a player ends his move on a field occupied by another stone, be it one of the team partner, opponent or one of his own stones, then this stone is removed from play.

In the 4 players version, the two opposite players build a team each. The team that first occupies the diagonally opposite corner field with a playing piece wins. A team loses if one of the players has no more playing pieces left on the board.

In the 3 players version, the player surrounded by two other players plays a solo against the two other players. If the solist reaches the diagonally opposite corner field, he/she wins. The two opponents win if they beat all solist's playing pieces.

Online Play


     4-player version on DevilPlay  (called "EinStein würfelt nicht - Quattro" there)

Name: Die Regenbogen-Karawane
Description:
The board displays a rainbow with 6 colored tracks. The player pawns are animals. Each animal carries a jewel on its back.
At each turn the player throws a die and moves his/her pawn. A player may move forward or sideways. If the jewel on the back of the animal corresponds with the course of the rainbow, the animal moves faster. Otherwise the animal moves slower.
The first player with all of his/her animals at the other end of the rainbow wins the game.

Name: Mauerfall 89
Description:
From the game's website (www.mauerfall89.de):
"Mauerfall 89" is a game with a political background which tries to focus the oblivion of the GDR (former eastern Germany). It deals with the fall of the Berliner wall in 1989. Goal of the game is the fall of the wall (respectively game stones) with demonstrations and attempts to escape - but the regime doesn't sleep...

"Mauerfall 89" was released in 2005 as a limited first edition.

Name: Hermann und Thusnelda verprügeln die Römer
Description:
From the publisher website:
Hermann und Thusnelda verprügeln die Römer (Hermann and Thusnelda beat up the Romans) deals with the Varus battle in the year 9 AD. In contrast to reality in the game the Romans has a real chance to win...
By request the game rules will also be in Latin!

Name: The Mystery of the Scream
Description:
This game is positioned as a family game it allows players to portray police detectives investigating the robbery or thieves who steal art. The game includes 36 cards that teach the players about different artwork.

The game is inspired by the theft of Munch's Scream, because of this the game has stirred some controversy

Name: Kick-It
Description:
"The fast game for long flanks, ideal passing and tactical moves."

Kick-it is a tactical soccer game that challenges the head and not the legs. The team in possession of the ball has 2 movement points available, while the opposing team without the ball has 3 move points available. By jumping straight over the opposing player, the ball can be taken away at any time.
To complete the move, the ball is passed over any number of your own players - preferably, of course, directly into the goal.

Name: Charge!
Description:
"Become a general in the Napoleonic Period and challenge a friend on the battlefield.  Charge! is a non-collectible card game for 2 players.  With Charge! you can revive the emotion of leading an Army and win a battle.  Dispatch your orders to your infantry regiments, fire at the enemy army with your cannons and force it to retreat with your cavalry charges."

A card war game involving advancing your units to break the line of your opponent.  Debuted at Essen 05.

Name: Die wilden Fussballkerle: Das dampfhammerharte Fussball-Spiel
Description:
"First a wild master, then a world master".

Die Wilden Fussball Kerle now have a full sized soccer board game.  Full teams of eleven players maneuver it out rolling dice and moving their players to get into position to score.

Simple rules and low complexity gear this towards younger players and those not seeking an in depth soccer simulation.

Name: Department Store Math
Description: Let's go shopping! Each player begins the game with $200. As purchases are made from the enclosed catalog, players make purchases and compute change using money up to $20. Coin chips from one cent to fifty cents, and currency from $1 to $20 is included. 2-4 players. Grades 4-8

Name: Match Wits Addition Facts
Description: This four-sided domino activity provides drill in addition facts with sums up to 20. It's a great activity for small groups of 2-4 players or for individual use. 120 problem answer combinations are possible with two levels of difficulty. For example, 2+4+3 matches 3+5+1 for a total of 9.

Name: Skim Math: Subtraction
Description: Skim Math - Subtraction is a fast-paced game that uses color-coded problem and answer cards while players race to match addition problems with their corresponding colored answers. For example: 3-1 is blue on the problem card and the blue answer card 2 wins that card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Name: Skim Math: Multiplication
Description: Skim Math - Multiplication is a fast-paced game that uses color-coded problem and answer cards while players race to match addition problems with their corresponding colored answers. For example: 4X3 is blue on the problem card and the blue answer card 12 wins that card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Name: Skim Math: Division
Description: Skim Math- Division is a fast-paced game that uses color-coded problem and answer cards while players race to match addition problems with their corresponding colored answers. For example: 12 divided by 4 is blue on the problem card and the blue answer card 3 wins that card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Name: Skim Math: Addition
Description: Skim Math - Addition is a fast-paced game that uses color-coded problem and answer cards while players race to match addition problems with their corresponding colored answers. For example: 3+4 is blue on the problem card and the blue answer card 7 wins that card. that card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Name: Money Dominoes
Description: Players have fun with these unique dominoes by matching coin values in written, numerical, and pictorial form. 45 dominoes and game suggestions are included. This activity may be used for individual or small group play.

Name: Bist Du sicher?
Description: Bist Du sicher? (Are you safe?) is a game about life, and the problems that come one's way.  Players draw tiles, resulting in both positive events and successes, as well as setbacks.  However, players can take the cash they collect to buy insurance to negate the negative effects of the setbacks.  It is essentially a multi-player solitaire game, and each player has a private board to track their accomplishments.

Name: Expedition zu den alten Mayastätten
Description:
Players are on an expedition to discover ancient Mayan temples and capture their treasures. You must help each other on the trek through the jungle, but if you reach a temple site, you must then compete for the rewards. The card game has different phases in which players secretly lay cards to make the expedition's total value exceed the hazards. You can try and trick the others by resting on the journey, but if this means that trek fails, you must pass out your highest cards to the others. Then at the temples, players use their cards to beat each other to the treasures.

The 64 card deck uses authentic b&w illustrations from contemporary explorations of the nineteenth century, which lend the game a strong theme. The cards have simple German text. The cardstock is laminated but flimsy, and while the production is good for a first release, gamers may expect better. However, the price at Essen 2005 was only €4 which was fair. German rules only in the box.

Name: Munera Sine Missione
Description:
Munera Sine Missione is a free set of miniatures rules which are designed to allow players to recreate gladiatorial combat in the arenas of Ancient Rome. The are designed to give a very quick, simple game, which can be played in ten or so minutes

The game uses a hex grid to regulate movement, and each gladiator has a number of action points to spend each turn. These points can be spent to move or attack other gladiators. Attacks are resolved by a simple roll-off between the attacker and defender, with the attacker getting bonuses for position. The defender gets a save roll to avoid wounds. Play continues until a gladiator loses all of their wounds.

Rules for a wide range of weapons are included,and all major historical gladiator types can be depicted with little problem.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Picture Perfect
Description:
Be the first player/team to score 50 or more points by identifying famous faces randomly assorted in 5 major categories: Movies, Television, & Radio; History; Sports, Recreation, & Leisure; Music, Arts, & Literature; and Miscellaneous.

Includes 400 famous faces cards and instruction sheet

Name: Face Value, Place Value
Description: 40 creative cards show children's faces featuring numbers that represent the "face value" for each card. A place value spinner focuses attention on the value of the digits on each card. Set A contains numbers that emphasize ones, tens, and hundreds places. For example: If a player's Face Value card number is 945 and the spinner lands on "tens", the player gets 4 point since the 4 is in the tens place. This is a great activity for small group or full class participation. Grades 1-3

Name: Tic Tac Fraction Slices
Description: Using this unique tic-tac-toe format, students enjoy competitive drill at three levels of difficulty while they learn to recognize fractional parts.

Name: Sonic Skillball
Description: The Aim & Score Arcade Action Game!  With Electronic Light and Sounds.  A game for the entire family!

Name: Zoboomafoo
Description:
Box front:

What a wonderful party!  Gather three animal friends and the foods they eat.  Get them to the party first, and win the game!  Fun for the entire family.

Box back:

You're invited to join Zoboo, the loveable lemur, and all his Animal Friends in Animal Junction!  Travel around the colorful gameboard and look for the three animals that are on your special invitation card, plus a food that each of them likes to eat.  After all, it's no party without snacks!

Children will have fun developing matching skills while learning what their favorite animals like to eat.  The first player to get matching cards for all three animals on their card AND one yummy food card for each animal is the winner.

Ages 3 and up.

Name: Purchase
Description: Financial accountability! With this exciting game, players learn to make purchases and keep financial records of their purchases on their personal financial record sheet. They also have the opportunity to earn money and make strategy decisions while keeping track of their income and cash balance. 2-4 players. Grades 4-8

Name: Spelling Bee II
Description: 600 high utility words are contained within the bonus word list and on the gameboard. Words have been carefully selected from current spelling word lists for 4th through 7th grade. Players travel around the gameboard and find words that are misspelled on a list in the square where they land. The game is self-correcting and fun to play. 2-4 Players - Grades 4-7

Name: Spell Checkers
Description: This self-correcting game reinforces spelling skills from primary to intermediate grades. Players with different learning abilities may play at the same time using an extensive list of spelling words that are included. Weekly spelling lists may be substituted in order to adapt the game to your classroom needs. Grades K-8 Great for two players or two teams.

Name: Tower Siege Expansion: Elemental Adversaries
Description:
"Elemental Adversaries" is a 15 card expansion pack for the non-collectible customizable "Tower Siege" fantasy card game (#4649).

It contains the following cards:
Arromus 
Amulet of Spell Casting 
Apprentice 
Boiling Oil 
Divine Light 
Electrum Coin 
Hidden Powerstone 
Librahm of Sorcery 
Lore Stone 
Mine 
Priest 
Raze 
Roklor 
Shelter 
Vein of Gold

Expands:

    Tower Siege
